text.p: In this exercise, you are tasked to complete the implementation of the doBrowsePhoto() method in the CountryMapMouseListener class. Upon completion, the pinned photos can be scaled up by left clicking on the mouse and rescaled back to its original size by right clicking on the mouse.
The project template for this graded task can be downloaded here.
The demo project for this graded task can be downloaded here.

ol.li: The doBrowsePhoto() method takes in a MouseEvent object as the parameter. Use the instance methods of the MouseEvent class to initialize four different variables according to the steps below. The Javadoc of the MouseEvent class can be found here.
Create a int local variable, x, and initialize it with the x position of the mouse event.
Create an int local variable, y, and initialize it with the y position of the mouse event.

Create a boolean local variable, leftClicked, and initialize it to true if the left mouse button is clicked during the event. Otherwise, initialize it to false. Hints: the left mouse button is clicked if the getButton() instance method returns a value equals to the static constant BUTTON1 in the MouseEvent class.

Create a boolean local variable, rightClicked, and initialize it to true if the right mouse button is clicked during the event. Otherwise, initialize it to false. Hints: the right mouse button is clicked if the getButton() instance method returns a value equals to the static constant BUTTON3 in the MouseEvent class.

li.font: Submit ONLY the code for initializing the four variables. The remaining code given in the doBrowsePhoto() method must not be submitted.

p.u: Instructions on the running the program

ol.li: To run the program, right click on the CountryMapApp class and invoke the main method.
The program operates in three modes, Browse mode, Pin mode and Delete mode. The program is in Browser mode by default.
To add a photo, press the Pin mode button and click on a location on the map. The image chosen from the pop up dialog will be added to the clicked location on the map.
To rescale a photo, press the Browser mode button. Left click on a photo for scaling it up and right click on the photo for rescaling it to its original size.
To delete a photo, press the Delete mode button. Left click on a photo to delete it.
